Generation IV.Diamond: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
Generation IV.Pearl: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
Generation IV.Platinum: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
Generation IV.HeartGold: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.

Generation V.Black: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
Generation V.White: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
Generation V.Black 2: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
Generation V.White 2: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.

Generation VI.X: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
Generation VI.Y: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

Generation VII.Sun: A team of researchers is scouring the oceans of the world in search of a Gastrodon in a color never seen before.
Generation VII.Moon: Experiments are being conducted to discover what happens when a Gastrodon is raised in a location other than the sea where it was born.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When it's attacked, it gushes a purple liquid that's not poisonous but makes Gastrodon's meat bitter and inedible.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: A relative of Shellder and Cloyster, this ocean dweller sometimes comes onto land in search of food.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
Generation VIII.Sword: It secretes a purple fluid to deter enemies. This fluid isn't poisonous—instead, it's super sticky, and once it sticks, it's very hard to unstick.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its body is covered in a sticky slime. It's very susceptible to dehydration, so it can't spend too much time on land.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Found more often on the land than in the sea. More active when it's cloudy or rainy out than when the weather is fair.

Generation IX.Scarlet: They normally inhabit rocky seashores, but in times of continuous rain, they can sometimes be found in the mountains, far from the sea.
Generation IX.Violet: Fishers say that they didn't see many of these Pokémon in the past, but this form of Gastrodon is now increasing in number.
